results.title: The Bradman era
results.creator_credit: Albie Thoms, ABC Video and Jack Egan
results.brief_description: This film, a companion to the book, traces the career of Sir Donald Bradman from the early 1930s through until 1948 when he led an undefeated Australian team in England in his last test series. The film also contains coverage of many of the controversial incidents during the “Bodyline” series in 1932-33 and shows the great players in action. Rated: G

results.title: A Phoenix rising
results.brief_description: A documentary film showing how the community of Mt. Macedon is piecing together its life again after being annihilated by the fires of Ash Wednesday. The film is based on interviews with some of the residents and gives case studies of a couple of families. Written and narrated by John Bonney.

results.title: More tricks than we have (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An introduction to how theatre in education works. Begins with a group of actors from Toe Truck Theatre and their director in the early stages of devising a play. We see the performance and follow up discussions and workshops. Based on the play “Year 9 are animals”, which tells the story of an enthusiastic first year teacher and the problems he encounters.

results.title: Communication at work
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Trigger series 7. Managing people”.
Dramatisations of seven brief interactions between staff members. Designed to trigger discussion on communication at work.

results.title: Decisions in academic departments
results.creator_credit: George Pashuk and University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Trigger series 7. Managing people”.
Six dramatisations dealing with interpersonal aspects of staff management are designed to trigger discussion. Although set in a university the issues raised are common to all organisations.

results.title: Because They're Black
results.creator_credit: Rosemary Burden, Roy Wooding, South Australian Film Corporation and Education Dept, S A
results.brief_description: A series of revealing interviews with Aboriginal students show what pressures exist for them in a white racist society. Teachers, parents and teacher’s aides are also interviewed. A good discussion starter for all those involved in the education of Aboriginal students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rosemary Burden, Roy Wooding, South Australian Film Corporation and Education Dept, S A
